page.title: 09CAISTOR MARKET PLACE TOILETS
page.content: Public toilets were erected in Caistor market place in 1961 after a long debate concerning their location. Vandalism of the toilets has got progressively worse since they became the meeting place for groups of youths,and many local people consider the toilet block an eyesore in an otherwise quaint market square. Campaigns for their removal led by {The Caistor Society, Mrs.M.Drakes and Mr.A. Baker, secretary{Caistor Labour {Party}has been going on since 1979.The issue was raised at{West Lindsey {District Council}who suggested the toilets should be locked after 4.30pm. After a Labour Party petition was presented,the District Council relented and agreed to their demolition and relocation,probably behind the magistrates court. The block was demolished in July 1985.
